description._content: Creator: Davis, Fremont 1915-1977 Subject: Meyers, Marina Prajmovsky 1924-1974        Radcliffe College        Yale University        Naval Research Laboratory (U.S.) Type: Black-and-white photographs Topic: Science fairs      Women scientists      Biology      Ophthalmology Local number: SIA Acc. 90-105 [SIA2009-1668] Summary: Science Talent Search winner Marina Prajmovsky (Meyers) (1924-1974) used her scholarship to attend Radcliffe College, where she majored in biology. She then received her M.D. at Yale University, conducted research on eye diseases, and eventually became an ophthalmologist in private practice. The original photograph caption referred to the fact that she then had a "vacation" job at Naval Research Laboratory in Washington, D.C Cite as: Acc. 90-105 - Science Service, Records, 1920s-1970s, Smithsonian Institution Archives Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Institution Archives View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
